item.title: Cucinelli 重申其在俄罗斯的运营符合欧盟规则
item.description: 意大利奢侈品公司布鲁内罗-库奇内利（Brunello Cucinelli）周三重申，该公司在俄罗斯的运营完全符合欧盟规定，第三季度收入增长了 12%，达到 3.36 亿欧元（约合 3.94 亿美元）。【原文：Italian luxury company Brunello Cucinelli reaffirmed on Wednesday that it operated in Russia in full compliance with EU regulations, as it posted a 12% increase in revenues in the third quarter, to 336 million euros ($394 million).】

item.title: 微软将 Xbox Game Pass 最高订阅费用提高 50
item.description: 微软公司的 Xbox 已将 Game Pass 最高级别的价格提高了 50%，并扩大了电子游戏订阅服务的产品范围，包括更多游戏、增强型云流媒体和经过改进的奖励系统。【原文：Microsoft's Xbox has raised the price of the highest tier of Game Pass by 50% and expanded its offerings under the videogame subscription service to include more games, enhanced cloud streaming and a revamped rewards system.】

item.title: 独家报道无人机袭击后俄罗斯西部港口石油出口增长 25
item.description: 据三位贸易消息人士称，由于乌克兰无人机袭击导致炼油厂停工，释放了更多原油，俄罗斯 9 月份通过其西部港口的石油出口量比 8 月份增加了 25%。【原文：Russia boosted oil exports via its western ports by 25% in September versus August, according to three trading sources, as refinery outages caused by Ukrainian drone attacks freed up more crude.】

item.title: 德国大陆集团预计下半年关税将达到 "两位数百万欧元"。
item.description: 德国大陆集团（Continental AG）周三表示，预计 2025 年下半年将受到美国关税 "高达两位数百万欧元 "的冲击，并补充说这已经考虑到了自 8 月份起追溯到 15%的关税削减。【原文：Continental AG expects a "high double-digit million-euro" hit from U.S. tariffs in the second half of 2025, it said on Wednesday, adding this already factored in a retroactive cut to 15% as of August.】

item.title: 金刚石公司首席执行官认为美国原油产量增长将因每桶 60 美元的油价而停滞不前
item.description: 美国顶级石油生产商之一钻石能源公司（Diamondback Energy）的首席执行官周三表示，如果油价维持在每桶 60 美元附近，美国石油产量的增长将停滞不前，因为在这一水平上有利可图的钻井地点越来越少。【原文：U.S. oil production growth will stall if prices stay near $60 per barrel, as fewer drilling sites are profitable at that level, the CEO of Diamondback Energy , one of the country's top oil producers, said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 通用汽车第三季度美国汽车销量增长约 8
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周三公布，受电动汽车和 SUV 需求强劲的推动，其第三季度美国汽车销量增长了 7.7%。【原文：General Motors reported a 7.7% rise in its U.S. auto sales during the third-quarter on Wednesday, aided by strong demand for electric vehicles and SUVs.】

item.title: 丰田汽车第三季度美国销量增长近 16
item.description: 丰田汽车北美分公司周三公布的汽车销量增长近 16%，主要得益于皮卡和轿车的销售。【原文：Toyota Motor's North American unit reported a near 16% rise in auto sales on Wednesday, helped by sales of its pickup trucks and cars.】

item.title: 亿万富翁支持的比特币公司 OranjeBTC 将在巴西交易所开始交易
item.description: 巴西加密货币公司 OranjeBTC 计划下周开始在当地证券交易所 B3 上市交易，试图挑战金融科技公司 Meliuz 的主导地位，后者是巴西首家拥有比特币财务战略的上市公司。【原文：Brazilian cryptocurrency firm OranjeBTC is scheduled to begin trading on the local stock exchange B3 next week as it tries to challenge the dominance of fintech Meliuz , the first listed firm to have a bitcoin treasury strategy in the country.】

item.title: 联邦资金耗尽，美国金融监管机构开始关闭
item.description: 由于美国国会未能延长拨款，联邦政府于周三关闭，美国市场监管机构开始裁员，从而削弱了关键的监督职能，阻碍了首次公开募股，并限制了一些市场和经济数据。 根据美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）的应急计划，从午夜开始的停摆将迫使该机构90%以上的员工休假，仅保留约393名员工处理紧急执法行动和市场监管工作。 据路透社报道，负责监管数千家上市公司、交易所、经纪商和基金的该机构于周二晚间通知员工为停摆做好准备。 美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）在周二晚间公布的一份计划中称，负责监管衍生品市场的CFTC计划仅以543人中的5.7%开展工作，他们将继续确保市场监督，防止欺诈和滥用。 虽然市场普遍对之前的短暂停摆不以为然，但长期停摆将推迟或取消投资者用来评估宏观经济趋势的关键经济数据发布，从而可能造成资产价格波动。周三，华尔街期货和美元跌跌不休，黄金则创下历史新高。 美国证券交易委员会（SEC）的常规公司备案工作将继续进行，但该机构将无法处理首次公开募股（IPO），这可能会抑制近期IPO市场的复苏。 "Mergermarket股票资本市场主管塞缪尔-克尔（Samuel Kerr）说："在政治不确定性加剧之际，停摆让投资者有理由三思是否购买新交易。【原文：U.S. market regulators began the process of furloughing workers on Wednesday as the federal government shut down after Congress failed to extend funding, curtailing key oversight functions, stymieing initial public offerings, and limiting some market and economic data. The shutdown, which began at midnight, will force the Securities and Exchange Commission to furlough more than 90% of its workforce, retaining only about 393 employees to handle emergency enforcement actions and market surveillance, according to its contingency plan. The agency, which regulates thousands of listed companies, exchanges, broker-dealers, and funds notified staff on Tuesday evening to prepare for the shutdown, Reuters reported. The CFTC, which oversees derivatives markets, plans to operate with just 5.7% of its 543 people, who will continue to ensure market oversight and prevent fraud and abuse, the CFTC said in a plan published Tuesday evening. While markets have generally shrugged off previous short-lived shutdowns, a prolonged one would delay or cancel key economic data releases investors use to assess macroeconomic trends, potentially creating asset price volatility. Wall Street futures and the dollar stumbled on Wednesday, while gold struck a record high. Routine company SEC filings will continue, but the agency will not be able to process IPOs, potentially dampening a recent IPO market revival. "A shutdown gives investors a reason to think twice on whether to buy into new deals at a time of heightened political uncertainty," said Samuel Kerr, head of equity capital markets at Mergermarket.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会称，美国消费者不能在美国联邦贸易委员会关门期间向其报告欺诈行为
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（U.S. Federal Trade Commission）周三表示，在政府关门期间，该机构将不会受理消费者的欺诈投诉或帮助他们阻止垃圾邮件电话，也不会提前批准合并。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission will not take consumers' fraud complaints or help them block spam calls, and it will not grant early clearance to mergers during the government shutdown, the agency said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧洲范围警告：美国政府停摆对信用评级不利
item.description: 欧洲评级机构 Scope 表示，美国政府的关门对美国面临降级威胁的信用评分来说是另一个负面因素。【原文：European rating agency Scope has said that the shutdown of the U.S. government is another negative for the country's downgrade-threatened credit score.】

item.title: 激进投资者在本季度开展了 61 项活动，是有史以来最繁忙的一个季度
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays）的最新数据显示，在第三季度，推动公司进行运营变革和管理层调整的激进投资者对全球企业发起的攻击次数创下新高，并赢得了更多的董事会席位和和解协议。【原文：Activist investors who push companies for operational changes and management shake-ups launched a record number of attacks on global corporations in the third quarter and won more board seats and settlements, new data from Barclays show.】

item.title: Coinbase 将面临范围缩小的股东诉讼
item.description: 一名联邦法官表示，Coinbase 股东可以提起范围缩小的诉讼，指控这家美国最大的加密货币交易所运营商隐瞒业务风险，包括是否会被美国证券交易委员会起诉。【原文：A federal judge said Coinbase shareholders may pursue a narrowed lawsuit accusing the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange operator of concealing business risks, including whether it would be sued by the Securities and Exchange Commission.】

item.title: 美联储降息，美元面临长期疲软
item.description: 路透社对外汇策略师进行的一项调查显示，自今年年初以来一直承压的美元在未来12个月内可能难以找到其相对于大多数主要货币的立足点。【原文：The U.S. dollar, under pressure since the start of the year, may struggle to find its footing against most major currencies over the coming 12 months, according to a Reuters poll of FX strategists who said the already crowded short U.S. dollar trade will remain.】

item.title: 数据显示，比亚迪季度汽车销量自2020年以来首次下滑
item.description: 路透社根据比亚迪周三发布的公司文件计算得出，比亚迪第三季度销量同比下降 2.1%，这是这家中国电动汽车和混合动力汽车制造商五年多来首次出现季度下滑。【原文：BYD's third-quarter sales fell 2.1% from a year earlier, according to Reuters' calculations based on a company filing released on Wednesday, the first quarterly decline for the Chinese EV and hybrid car maker in more than five years.】

item.title: 卫星初创公司 Spacecoin 通过太空发送数据，欲与 Starlink 竞争
item.description: 美国初创公司 Spacecoin 周三表示，它已成功地通过太空发送了安全信息，这在业内尚属首次。【原文：U.S. startup Spacecoin said on Wednesday it had successfully sent secured information through space in what it said was a first for the industry as the firm tries to show it can offer an alternative to Starlink's satellite internet service.】

item.title: 9 月美国制造业有望复苏，订单减少
item.description: 美国制造业在 9 月份开始复苏，但新订单和就业情况不佳，因为工厂仍在努力应对进口关税带来的影响。【原文：U.S. manufacturing edged toward recovery in September, though new orders and employment were subdued as factories continued to grapple with the fallout from tariffs on imports.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"小组强调必须全面遵守石油产量限制规定
item.description: 欧佩克在会后发表的一份声明中说，欧佩克+小组在周三的在线会议上强调了全面遵守石油产出协议的必要性。【原文：An OPEC+ panel stressed the need for achieving full compliance with oil output agreements at its online meeting on Wednesday, OPEC said in a statement after the meeting.】

item.title: 杜克能源公司在卡罗莱纳州能源计划中考虑核反应堆和煤炭扩建
item.description: 作为旨在满足卡罗莱纳州急剧增长的电力需求的长期能源计划的一部分，美国电力公司杜克能源正在考虑为其机组增加大型核反应堆，并延长一些煤电厂的寿命。【原文：U.S. power company Duke Energy is considering adding large nuclear reactors to its fleet and extending the life of some coal plants as part of a long-term energy plan aimed at meeting sharply rising electricity demand in the Carolinas.】

item.title: 福特第三季度美国汽车销量增长 8.2
item.description: 福特汽车公司（Ford Motor Co）周三公布的第三季度美国汽车销量增长了 8.2%，主要得益于对 SUV 和皮卡的稳定需求。【原文：Ford Motor Co reported an 8.2% rise in its third-quarter U.S. auto sales on Wednesday, aided by steady SUV and pickup truck demand.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局（FAA）的 "NextGen "空中交通改革面临长期拖延和预算超支问题
item.description: 本周三发布的一份报告称，美国联邦航空管理局于 2003 年启动的耗资 150 亿美元的空中交通管制大修项目已面临多次延误、成本超支，其雄心壮志也不如原计划。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration's $15 billion project to overhaul air traffic control launched in 2003 has faced numerous delays, cost overruns and is less ambitious than planned, a report issued Wednesday said.】

item.title: 聚焦：降价谈判破裂后，药品制造商面临特朗普关税压力
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要对品牌药品征收100%的关税，这给制药公司带来了更大的压力，迫使它们在今年早些时候谈判破裂后同意降价并转移生产。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to impose 100% tariffs on branded drugs ratcheted up pressure on pharmaceutical companies to agree price cuts and shift manufacturing after talks faltered earlier this year, industry lobbyists and executives said.】

item.title: GoodRx 扩大与 Kroger 的合作，以折扣价提供品牌药品
item.description: GoodRx 公司周三表示，它已与克罗格公司（Kroger）的医疗保健部门合作，扩大其品牌药物处方储蓄服务，包括诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk）的流行减肥药 Wegovy。【原文：GoodRx said on Wednesday it has partnered with Kroger's healthcare unit to expand its prescription savings services for branded drugs, including Novo Nordisk's popular weight-loss drug Wegovy.】

item.title: T-Mobile 扩展卫星网络，在移动死角支持 WhatsApp 和 X
item.description: T-Mobile 周三表示，其卫星对蜂窝网络现在支持广泛使用的应用程序，包括 WhatsApp、谷歌地图和 X，扩大了为移动死角和偏远地区提供连接的服务范围。【原文：T-Mobile said on Wednesday its satellite-to-cell network now supports widely used apps, including WhatsApp, Google Maps and X, broadening the service that offers connectivity to mobile dead zones and remote regions.】

item.title: Meta 将从 12 月起使用人工智能聊天来个性化内容和广告
item.description: Meta Platforms 周三表示，从 12 月 16 日开始，该公司将利用人们与其生成式人工智能工具的互动，在 Facebook 和 Instagram 等应用中个性化内容和广告。【原文：Meta Platforms said on Wednesday it would begin using people's interactions with its generative AI tools to personalize content and advertising across its apps such as Facebook and Instagram starting on December 16.】

item.title: 独家报道与苹果、联发科的竞争白热化，高通将芯片转向更新的 Arm 技术
item.description: 熟悉内情的消息人士称，高通公司已将其旗舰芯片转向 Arm Holdings 的最新一代计算架构，该架构具有旨在提高人工智能性能的新功能，此举可能会提高 Arm 的收入，并有助于高通公司的芯片与联发科和苹果公司的产品竞争。【原文：Qualcomm has shifted its flagship chips to the latest generation of Arm Holdings' computing architecture with new features aimed at better AI performance, sources familiar with the matter said, a move that could boost Arm's revenues and help Qualcomm's chips compete against offerings from MediaTek and Apple.】

item.title: UnitedHealth 将退出美国 16 个县的医疗保险优势计划
item.description: UnitedHealth 表示将于 2026 年停止在美国 16 个县提供医疗保险优势计划，这将影响到 18 万名会员，因为该公司需要平衡成本上升与保险计划报销压力之间的关系。【原文：UnitedHealth said it will stop offering Medicare Advantage plans in 16 U.S. counties in 2026, impacting 180,000 members, as the company balances higher costs with reimbursement pressure in the insurance program.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，英国再次尝试获取苹果云数据
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三报道，尽管美国声称英国已经放弃了破解这家科技巨头加密技术的所有尝试，但英国政府还是向苹果公司发出了新的命令，要求苹果公司为其云存储服务创建一个后门，这次只针对英国用户的数据。【原文：Britain's government has issued a new order to Apple to create a backdoor into its cloud storage service, this time targeting only British users' data, despite U.S. claims that Britain had abandoned all attempts to break the tech giant's encryption, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国九月份私营部门就业人数下降
item.description: 美国 9 月份的私营企业薪资出乎意料地下降，表明劳动力市场状况有所减弱。【原文：U.S. private payrolls unexpectedly fell in September, suggesting a weakening in labor market conditions.】

item.title: 耐克反弹势头强劲，但中国和关税问题成阴霾
item.description: 耐克首席执行官埃利奥特-希尔（Elliott Hill）去年执掌耐克时，曾发誓要让公司回归运动服装的本源，他的努力正在取得成果，但中国经济复苏乏力和关税的不确定性仍在拖累耐克。【原文：Nike CEO Elliott Hill vowed to return the company to its sportswear roots when he took the helm last year in a much-touted change and his efforts are bearing fruit, but a sluggish recovery in China and uncertainty over tariffs remain a drag.】
